page.title: 17The Motorway.
page.content: The Denton relief road is part of the M67 which completes the motorway radial route from the Manchester outer ring road to the Hyde by-pass.It's western end will eventually connect with the M66 Denton to Middleton motorway. It was constructed in two sections which met outside St.Anne's School,to provide a free route through the heavily built up centre of Denton to carry the high volume of traffic which severely congested the east west route.The eastern section began in earnest in the summer of 1975 and the motorway opened on 6th September 1981. The road system had needed improvment for many years,so the Ministry of Transport, asked Sir William Halcrow and Partners to report on a route selected by the County Surveyor of Cheshire.
